content: Created a comprehensive `.dockerignore` that excludes VCS metadata, caches, virtual environments, build artifacts, and common large output directories to keep Docker build contexts small and reproducible.

output.code:
from pathlib import Path
import json

target_path = Path('/mnt/data').joinpath('.dockerignore')
target_path.parent.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)

chunks = [
""".git
.gitignore
.gitattributes
.gitmodules
.github""",
"""__pycache__/
*.py[cod]
*$py.class
.pytest_cache/
.mypy_cache/
.ruff_cache/
.pytype/
.pyre/
.pyright/
.coverage
.coverage.*
htmlcov/
.cache/""",
"""*.log
*.tmp
*.swp
*.swo
.DS_Store
Thumbs.db""",
"""# Virtual environments
.venv/
venv/
ENV/
env/
.conda/
.python-version
pip-wheel-metadata/""",
"""# Build artifacts
build/
dist/
*.egg-info/
.eggs/
wheels/
pip-wheel-metadata/
*.whl""",
"""# Tooling / CI artifacts
.tox/
.nox/
pytestdebug.log
.hypothesis/
.ipynb_checkpoints/
.notebook/
.ipython/
junit*.xml""",
"""# Benchmark outputs (can be large; keep inputs/configs)
benchmarks/**/results/
benchmark_results/
outputs/
runs/
wandb/"""
]

final_text = '\n'.join(block.strip('\n') for block in chunks).strip() + '\n'
target_path.write_text(final_text, encoding='utf-8')

print('FILE_WRITTEN:.dockerignore')
print('DIR_STATE:' + json.dumps(sorted(str(p.relative_to(Path("/mnt/data"))) for p in target_path.parent.glob('*') if p.is_file())))

content.text: Created a comprehensive `.dockerignore` that excludes VCS metadata, caches, virtual environments, build artifacts, and common large output directories to keep Docker build contexts small and reproducible.
